The intervention group also showed significant improvement from baseline to post-intervention (p = 0.0001).
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients with restless legs syndrome (n = 42).
effective_dosage: Effleurage massage with lavender oil (specific dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of Thai traditional massage versus Tamsulosin in relieving lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS) in Thai men.
results_summary: Thai traditional massage significantly improved total IPSS and voiding scores, with comparable improvements in quality of life and uroflowmetry parameters to Tamsulosin, suggesting it as a potential alternative treatment for LUTS.
population_specificity: Thai men aged 50 to 75 years with lower urinary tract symptoms (N=45).
effective_dosage: Thai traditional massage administered for 4 weeks (specific frequency not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test whether sunflower seed oil (SSO) therapy enhances neonatal growth and reduces morbidity at the population level in rural Uttar Pradesh, India.
results_summary: Intervention infants gained significantly more weight (0.94 g·kg⁻¹·d⁻¹) than comparison infants, with the largest benefits seen in infants weighing <2000 g at birth. Per-protocol analysis showed reduced hospitalization and illness rates by 36% and 44%, respectively, in treated infants.
population_specificity: Newborn infants in rural Uttar Pradesh, India, including very-preterm infants.
effective_dosage: Not specified (exclusive use of SSO for massage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of abdominal massage on enteral nutrition complications in adult critically ill patients.
results_summary: Abdominal massage significantly reduced gastric residual volume, vomiting, abdominal distension, and ventilator-associated pneumonia in critically ill patients. The results were statistically significant but limited by small sample sizes and short intervention periods.
population_specificity: Adult critically ill patients (aged ≥18 years) receiving enteral nutrition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of partner-delivered massage as a technique to manage mild antenatal anxiety in pregnant women.
results_summary: Partner-delivered massage was found to be an accessible and practical method for managing mild anxiety in pregnant women, with additional benefits for maternal mental health and partner connection post-birth. The study identified four key themes: Supporting mental health, Connecting, Useful and adaptable, and Making it happen.
population_specificity: Pregnant women self-assessing as mildly anxious (44 participants, with 14 in the massage group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize evidence on the effect of massage therapy on knee osteoarthritis, comparing standard massage and aromatherapy massage.
results_summary: Massage therapy showed significant short-term improvements in pain, stiffness, and functionality scores (1-8 weeks), but no long-term benefits. Aromatherapy massage reduced stiffness but was not superior to standard massage.
population_specificity: Individuals with knee osteoarthritis (737 participants across 12 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of Swedish massage on pain and painkiller consumption in rheumatoid arthritis patients.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in pain and painkiller consumption in the experimental group compared to the control group, both immediately after and one month post-intervention. The experimental group showed consistent decreases in pain and painkiller use over time.
population_specificity: Rheumatoid arthritis patients (n=60, split into control and experimental groups).
effective_dosage: 30-minute Swedish massage sessions, twice a week for the first four weeks and three times a week for the last four weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of high-quality nursing techniques, including limb or back massage, in improving patient comfort during cataract surgery.
results_summary: The study found that high-quality nursing techniques, such as limb or back massage, reduced postoperative pain and anxiety in cataract surgery patients. These interventions were part of a broader approach that also included preoperative education and soothing music.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing cataract surgery (total of 3,378 patients across 19 reports).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether slow-stroke back massage (SSBM) reduces fatigue levels in women with breast cancer undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: The study found that SSBM significantly reduced fatigue scores compared to routine treatment alone, with consistent effects across multiple chemotherapy cycles. The intervention group showed significant within-group improvements, while the control group did not.
population_specificity: Women with breast cancer receiving chemotherapy (n=64).
effective_dosage: 20 minutes total (10 minutes before and after each chemotherapy infusion during the 2nd, 3rd, and 4th cycles).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of nonpharmacological interventions, including massage, on symptoms and disease-specific quality of life in fibromyalgia patients.
results_summary: Massage improved Fibromyalgia Impact Questionnaire (FIQ) scores, indicating a positive effect on overall symptom burden in fibromyalgia patients. The study did not specify the magnitude of improvement for massage compared to other interventions.
population_specificity: People with fibromyalgia aged >16 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of complementary and integrative therapies, including massage, on fatigue in hemodialysis patients.
results_summary: The study found that massage, along with other therapies like acupressure and aromatherapy, was effective in reducing pain and anxiety and improving sleep quality in hemodialysis patients. These methods were recommended for inclusion in routine clinical care.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients with chronic kidney failure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review treatment strategies for facial synkinesis, including the role of massage as part of facial rehabilitation.
results_summary: The study found that facial rehabilitation, including soft tissue massage, is a cornerstone of treatment for facial synkinesis, often combined with other therapies like botulinum toxin chemodenervation and neuromuscular retraining.
population_specificity: Patients with enduring facial paralysis and synkinesis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the rationale and evidence for using touch-based therapies, such as massage, in treating older patients with psychiatric symptoms.
results_summary: The study found that massage therapy provides significant short-term improvement in symptoms, particularly for psychological variables and subjective symptoms like pain and quality of life, but effects are not sustained long-term. Evidence is stronger for psychological benefits, and promising results were noted for depressive symptoms in dementia patients.
population_specificity: Older patients with psychiatric symptoms, including those with chronic musculoskeletal disorders and dementia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether Swedish massage could relieve symptoms of knee osteoarthritis (OA) and improve gait spatiotemporal parameters in patients with knee OA.
results_summary: The intervention group showed significant pain relief, improved function, increased gait speed, total support time, and single support time, as well as decreased step width and initial double support time compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Thirty adult women with knee osteoarthritis.
study_duration: 12 sessions (duration per session not specified beyond 20-30 minutes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of therapeutic massage (TM) and positional release therapy (PRT) in treating trigger and tender points in the upper trapezius muscle.
results_summary: Both TM and PRT effectively reduced pain and acutely decreased muscle stiffness, though PRT showed clinically better pain reduction and pressure sensitivity improvements. Neither treatment maintained reduced muscle stiffness in males after 48 hours.
population_specificity: 60 healthy participants (24 male, 36 female) with upper trapezius pain and trigger points, aged 27.1 ± 8.8 years.
study_duration: Measurements taken at baseline, post-treatment, and 48 hours later (intervention duration not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of intraoral and extraoral massage methods, as part of a mobile app-based oral health education program, on tongue pressure and swallowing-related quality of life in elderly individuals.
results_summary: The intervention group showed a significant increase in tongue pressure from pre- to post-intervention (17.75 to 27.24), suggesting that the massage methods may have contributed to improved oral function.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals participating in a community-based integrated care project.
effective_dosage: 50 minutes per session, once a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize current evidence on mind-body interventions, including massage, for improving physical and psychological symptoms in heart failure patients.
results_summary: The review found that massage, as part of MBIs, could reduce physical and psychological symptoms and improve health outcomes in heart failure patients, with encouraging results on selected physiological and behavioral outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with heart failure (HF)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of massage as part of integrative oncology in improving symptom management and quality of life for cancer patients.
results_summary: The study suggests that massage, as part of integrative oncology, can help improve symptom management and quality of life in cancer patients, particularly in low- and middle-income countries where access to conventional care is limited. It highlights the need for further research and integration of such therapies into comprehensive cancer care.
population_specificity: Cancer patients, particularly in low- and middle-income countries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and safety of self-administered acupressure for allergic rhinitis (AR) and compare its effects between specific and non-specific acupressure points.
results_summary: No major adverse events were reported, and acupressure was deemed feasible and safe. While no statistically significant differences were found between specific and non-specific acupressure groups in symptom severity or medication usage, participants in the specific acupressure group perceived it as useful for AR and recommended it for self-care.
population_specificity: Fifteen allergic rhinitis patients.
effective_dosage: 1 minute per point, twice a day at five acupressure points.
study_duration: 4 weeks of treatment with an 8-week follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of Swedish massage (SM) and interferential electrical stimulation (IES) on labor pain, childbirth experience, satisfaction, duration of active phase, and side effects in primiparous women.
results_summary: Swedish massage significantly reduced labor pain, improved childbirth experience and satisfaction, and shortened the active phase of labor compared to routine care, with no serious side effects reported.
population_specificity: Primiparous women in labor.
effective_dosage: Two massage techniques (effleurage and petrissage) applied at cervical dilatation of 4 and 8-10 cm.
study_duration: Administered during labor (specific duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the feasibility of an intensive interprofessional lifestyle medicine program, including massage therapy, for patients with musculoskeletal conditions and lifestyle-related chronic diseases.
results_summary: The study found that 62% of program completers met their goals, with clinically meaningful improvements in PROMIS Anxiety scores, though massage-specific outcomes were not detailed separately.
population_specificity: Adults diagnosed with musculoskeletal conditions and lifestyle-related chronic diseases who had previously completed standard-of-care musculoskeletal treatments.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of stress-reduction interventions, including therapeutic massage, in reducing blood pressure among non-Hispanic black women.
results_summary: Therapeutic massage emerged as potentially beneficial in non-randomized pilot trials, with reductions in systolic BP up to 9 mmHg and diastolic BP up to 5 mmHg, though efficacy varied by intervention type and duration.
population_specificity: Non-Hispanic black women in the US.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of aromatherapy massage in reducing restless legs syndrome (RLS) severity and improving sleep quality in end-stage kidney disease (ESKD) patients on dialysis.
results_summary: Aromatherapy massage showed a significant reduction in RLS severity [MD 10.91 (95% CI 6.96-14.85)], though the confidence in the evidence was limited. No statistically significant adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: Adult ESKD patients on dialysis with RLS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of alternative physical treatments, including postoperative calf massage, for venous thromboembolism (VTE) prophylaxis in surgical and trauma patients.
results_summary: One study using postoperative calf massage reported a statistically significant reduction in deep venous thrombosis incidence when used with LMWH, but the overall evidence base was limited, with methodological flaws and high risk of bias in studies showing benefits.
population_specificity: Surgical and trauma patients contraindicated for standard VTE prophylaxis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of auricular massage with auricular acupuncture and acupressure on anxiety, burnout, and caring capacity in health care workers.
results_summary: The study found that auricular massage did not have a significant effect on State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), Professional Quality of Life (ProQOL), or Caring Ability Inventory (CAI) scores, unlike auricular acupressure, which showed reductions in burnout and secondary traumatic stress.
population_specificity: Health care workers at a 334-bed Level II pediatric trauma center.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether sunflower seed oil (SSO) massage could reduce neonatal mortality rate (NMR) compared to traditional mustard oil massage in rural settings.
results_summary: The study found no overall difference in NMR between SSO and mustard oil massage groups, but exclusive SSO use showed a significant 58% mortality reduction. A 52% NMR reduction was observed in infants weighing ≤1,500 g.
population_specificity: Newborn infants in rural Uttar Pradesh, India, within 7 days of delivery.
effective_dosage: 10 ml of SSO applied 3 times daily.
study_duration: Throughout the neonatal period (first 28 days of life).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of nonpharmacologic interventions, including massage therapy, for treating childhood functional constipation.
results_summary: The study indicated that abdominal massage is a promising therapy for childhood functional constipation, though the overall evidence was limited by a high risk of bias across studies. No significant adverse effects were reported for massage, but the data was not robust enough for definitive conclusions.
population_specificity: Children aged 2 weeks to 18 years with functional constipation (47% female).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how the microbiota of prostate secretion influences the clinical status of patients with chronic bacterial prostatitis, using post-massage urine analysis.
results_summary: The study identified aerobic-anaerobic bacterial associations in all patients, with varying predominance of aerobes or anaerobes in different groups, suggesting a link between microbiota composition and prostatitis symptoms.
population_specificity: Outpatients aged 18-45 years with a history of prostatitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review nonpharmacological interventions, including massage therapy, for reducing fatigue in Iranian hemodialysis (HD) patients.
results_summary: Massage therapy was one of several interventions found effective in reducing fatigue among HD patients, with 3 studies supporting its efficacy. The abstract does not provide detailed statistical outcomes for massage specifically.
population_specificity: Iranian hemodialysis patients (mean age 54.17 years, 61.38% male).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the success rates and efficiency of bladder stimulation and the Quick-Wee method for urine collection in infants under 1 year who require urine analysis.
results_summary: The study will evaluate the success rate of voiding at least 2 mL of urine within 5 minutes, time to collect urine, comfort, urine quality, and risk factors for failure between the two techniques. Results are pending as the study is ongoing.
population_specificity: Infants under 1 year and before walking who need urine analysis, recruited from four pediatric emergency departments in France.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to map the evidence on pediatric massage interventions and their reported health outcomes, assessing confidence levels and effectiveness.
results_summary: The study found that pediatric massage was evaluated across various health outcomes, with 28 showing positive effects, 6 no effect, and 1 mixed. High-quality studies highlighted benefits in neuro-motor development, growth, and stress disorders.
population_specificity: Pediatrics (children receiving massage therapy).

study_goal: To determine the effectiveness of massage therapy (MT) compared to other non-pharmacological interventions in improving behavioral and psychological symptoms in elders with dementia.
results_summary: The study found that massage therapy was included among the interventions but did not rank as the best for any specific symptom improvement; individualized nursing, behavior therapy, and reminiscence therapy outperformed it in various outcomes.
population_specificity: Elders with dementia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of non-pharmacological interventions, including massage by partners, in reducing anxiety during pregnancy and postpartum.
results_summary: The study found that massage by partners was one of the most effective interventions for reducing anxiety during pregnancy and postpartum, alongside other methods like behavioural activation and cognitive behavioural therapy.
population_specificity: Pregnant and postpartum women, with some interventions involving their partners.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the minimum effective dose of oxytocin during cesarean delivery in women with preeclampsia receiving magnesium sulfate compared to normotensive women not receiving magnesium sulfate.
results_summary: The study found that preeclampsia patients required a significantly higher oxytocin dose (24.9 IU/h) compared to normotensive patients (13.9 IU/h) to achieve satisfactory uterine tone. Oxytocin-related hypotension was more frequent in the preeclampsia group, but other side effects and outcomes like additional uterotonic use or uterine massage were similar between groups.
population_specificity: Nonlaboring patients with preeclampsia receiving magnesium sulfate and normotensive patients not receiving magnesium sulfate undergoing cesarean delivery.
effective_dosage: Oxytocin infusion started at 13 IU/h, adjusted in 2 IU/h increments based on response.
study_duration: Uterine tone assessed at 4 minutes after oxytocin initiation.
interactions: Magnesium sulfate was noted to influence oxytocin requirements.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of non-pharmacological sleep interventions, including massage, in improving sleep quality for critically ill adult patients in intensive care units.
results_summary: The study found that non-pharmacological interventions, including massage, generally improved sleep quality in critically ill patients, though the specific efficacy of massage was not isolated from other interventions. Most experimental studies reported positive outcomes, but further research is needed to confirm effectiveness.
population_specificity: Critically ill adult patients in intensive care units.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the long-term effectiveness of Fu's subcutaneous needling (FSN) therapy with massage therapy for treating chronic non-specific low back pain (NLBP).
results_summary: Massage therapy showed favorable results in improving pain intensity, functional outcomes, disability, and quality of life compared to baseline, but FSN therapy demonstrated more significant improvements in these measures at all follow-up time points.
population_specificity: 60 chronic NLBP patients recruited from Yongchuan Hospital of Chongqing Medical University.
study_duration: Evaluated at baseline, post-treatment, 3 months, and 12 months after treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Shiatsu massage could reduce agitation in mechanically ventilated patients.
results_summary: The study found that Shiatsu massage significantly reduced agitation levels in mechanically ventilated patients compared to the control group (p=.001). The intervention group showed a notable decrease in agitation post-treatment.
population_specificity: Mechanically ventilated patients in intensive care units.
effective_dosage: Three 5-minute periods of Shiatsu massage with 2-minute breaks between sessions.
study_duration: Single session (total intervention time: 15 minutes plus breaks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of MCT oil massage on growth (weight, length, and head circumference) in preterm infants.
results_summary: The study found that MCT oil massage significantly improved weight gain in preterm infants compared to massage alone or no massage, particularly from the 4th to 7th day. No significant differences were observed in head circumference or height, and no adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: Preterm infants weighing between 1500 and 2000 g.
effective_dosage: 10 mL/kg/day of MCT oil, divided into three applications.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the outcomes of retrograde manual lymphatic drainage combined with vascularized lymph node transfer versus complete decongestive therapy for treating extremity lymphedema.
results_summary: The study found that vascularized lymph node transfer with retrograde manual lymphatic drainage significantly improved circumferential reduction rates (38.9% vs. 13.2%) and quality-of-life scores compared to complete decongestive therapy. Distal recipient-site transfers showed more efficacious results than proximal ones in the literature review.
population_specificity: 138 unilateral extremity lymphedema patients (68 in complete decongestive therapy, 70 in vascularized lymph node transfer).
effective_dosage: Retrograde manual lymphatic drainage started 1 month postoperatively with intermittent manual compression and proximal-to-distal massage.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of Traditional Thai massage (TM) and the muscle energy (ME) technique on pain intensity, pressure pain threshold, neck disability, and neck flexion range of motion in patients with chronic neck pain associated with myofascial trigger points.
results_summary: Both TM and ME techniques significantly improved all measured parameters compared to the control group, with no significant differences observed between the two interventions. The study concluded that both methods are practical alternatives for treating chronic neck pain associated with myofascial trigger points.
population_specificity: Forty-five patients with chronic neck pain associated with myofascial trigger points.
effective_dosage: Eight treatment sessions over two weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of foot massage by a nurse or patient's family on the level of consciousness and delirium in ICU patients.
results_summary: The study found that Swedish foot massage did not significantly change the level of consciousness or delirium in ICU patients, though some non-significant reductions in delirium prevalence were observed.
population_specificity: Patients admitted to intensive care units (ICU).
effective_dosage: 10 minutes of Swedish foot massage once a day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if percussion therapy during rest periods increases repetitions before a 30% velocity loss threshold during bench press.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results, only the study's aim.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pain-inducing massage produces similar pain sensitivity reduction as a cold pressor task and if baseline conditioned pain modulation efficiency predicts hypoalgesia from pain-inducing massage.
results_summary: Pain-inducing massage produced comparable pain sensitivity changes to a cold pressor task, with baseline CPM efficiency influencing outcomes. Both interventions shared similar underlying mechanisms for pain modulation.
population_specificity: 60 healthy participants

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of physiotherapy techniques, including massage therapy, in treating primary dysmenorrhea (PD).
results_summary: The meta-analysis indicated that physiotherapy treatments, including massage, provided significant pain relief compared to no intervention or placebo, with a mean difference of -1.13 on the VAS scale. Massage was among the main techniques showing benefits for PD symptom alleviation.
population_specificity: 692 female participants with primary dysmenorrhea.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review the applicability of manual lymphatic drainage (MLD) in improving edema and clinical presentation post-musculoskeletal injuries.
results_summary: The study found that MLD was effective in reducing edema and pain, enhancing range of motion, and improving patients' quality of life and satisfaction. Half of the reviewed studies showed strong quality assessment, but further research is needed for broader applicability.
population_specificity: Patients with musculoskeletal injuries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review the effectiveness of different massage approaches on common MS symptoms, including fatigue, pain, anxiety, depression, and spasticity.
results_summary: Massage improved fatigue, pain, anxiety, depression, and spasticity in MS patients, with specific techniques like reflexology and Swedish massage showing effectiveness for different symptoms.
population_specificity: Patients with Multiple Sclerosis (PwMS)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of electrical automatic massage (EAM) on cognitive and non-cognitive functions in patients with Alzheimer's disease spectrum disorders.
results_summary: EAM attenuated changes in attention-associated cognitive scores and improved subjective sleep quality compared to controls. The findings suggest EAM may be an alternative therapy for managing symptoms in Alzheimer's disease.
population_specificity: Patients with Alzheimer's disease spectrum disorders.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy, safety, and underlying mechanisms of maxillofacial and oral massage (MOM) in reducing severe radiotherapy-induced oral mucositis in nasopharyngeal carcinoma patients undergoing intensity-modulated radiotherapy.
results_summary: MOM significantly reduced the incidence of severe oral mucositis (26.3% vs. 46.8%), delayed its onset, and shortened its duration. Adverse events were minimal (1.3% grade 3 or higher), and MOM increased anti-inflammatory lipid metabolites.
population_specificity: Nasopharyngeal carcinoma patients receiving intensity-modulated radiotherapy.
study_duration: Duration of radiotherapy (specific timeframe not mentioned in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of nebulization therapy combined with meibomian gland massage versus eye drops alone in improving ocular surface status and corneal higher-order aberrations in patients with meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD).
results_summary: The nebulization and massage group showed significantly better improvements in tear meniscus height, breakup time, and corneal aberrations compared to the eye drop group, with notable benefits in visual quality and comfort. Both groups improved in corneal fluorescein staining and Schirmer I test results, but the combined therapy demonstrated superior outcomes in key metrics.
population_specificity: 38 patients diagnosed with meibomian gland dysfunction (MGD).
effective_dosage: Not specified (azithromycin solution and esculin and digitalis glycoside eye drops were used).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of court-type traditional Thai massage (CTTM) and Thai hermit exercise (THE) in improving cervical range of motion (CROM) and reducing pain in the upper trapezius muscle for patients with myofascial pain syndrome.
results_summary: Both CTTM and THE significantly reduced pain and improved CROM, with CTTM showing a greater reduction in pain levels compared to THE. No significant difference was found in CROM improvement between the two treatments.
population_specificity: 46 patients with myofascial pain syndrome in the upper trapezius muscle.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the feasibility and acceptability of Reiki (a light touch therapy) as a nonpharmacological symptom management intervention for hospitalized children aged 1-5 years receiving palliative care.
results_summary: The study found that Reiki was feasible and acceptable, with most families completing the intervention and measures, and parents expressing willingness to continue Reiki. Results were comparable to prior studies on Reiki and massage for symptom management in pediatric palliative care.
population_specificity: Hospitalized children aged 1-5 years with chronic, life-limiting conditions receiving palliative care.
effective_dosage: Six protocolized Reiki sessions over 3 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effects of massage on aromatase inhibitor-associated knee joint pain in breast cancer survivors.
results_summary: Massage showed some therapeutic effects on knee joint pain, but yoga was significantly more effective. The study also noted changes in plasma cytokine levels and meridian energy associated with the interventions.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal women with oestrogen receptor-positive, early-stage, or metastatic breast cancer experiencing AI-associated knee joint pain.
study_duration: 6 weeks (plus 2-week rest and 6-week yoga exposure in crossover design).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of non-pharmacological interventions, including massage, for managing pain in patients with dementia.
results_summary: Massage was identified as the most common non-pharmacological intervention for pain management in dementia patients, though the play activities program was found to be the most effective. The study indicated that non-pharmacological interventions, including massage, had a positive effect on pain management in these patients.
population_specificity: Patients with dementia experiencing pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of massage therapy in alleviating occupational stress and improving physical and mental health in healthcare workers.
results_summary: Massage therapy alone was found to be more effective than non-intervention controls in reducing occupational stress (SMD -0.43; 95% CI [-0.72 to -0.14]), though yoga was identified as the best method overall.
population_specificity: Healthcare workers, particularly during the COVID-19 era.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of lavender essential oil massage on neuropathic pain and quality of life in diabetic patients.
results_summary: The study found that aromatherapy massage with lavender oil significantly reduced neuropathic pain in both short-term and long-term assessments and improved quality of life domains after four weeks, with no reported side effects.
population_specificity: Diabetic neuropathic patients (n=75).
effective_dosage: 2.5 cc of 3% lavender oil applied as a gentle foot massage for 10 minutes every night.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to map non-pharmacological interventions, including massage, for reducing acute pain in adult trauma victims across pre-hospital, emergency, and trauma-center settings.
results_summary: Massage was identified as one of several non-pharmacological interventions used for pain relief in trauma victims, but its efficacy was poorly described and primarily reported in minor traumas like simple fractures or small wounds. No robust conclusions were drawn about its effectiveness compared to other interventions.
population_specificity: Adult trauma victims aged 18 or older in pre-hospital, emergency, and trauma-center settings.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) treatments, including massage, as an additive therapy for asthma management.
results_summary: The study found that TCM, including massage, is a safe additive treatment to Western medicine that can improve asthma symptoms and quality of life, though efficacy details specific to massage were not separately highlighted.
population_specificity: Patients with asthma seeking alternative treatment options.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of olive oil massage on fatigue in hemodialysis patients and identify sociodemographic factors influencing fatigue reduction.
results_summary: The study found that olive oil massage significantly reduced fatigue in hemodialysis patients, with 53% of the intervention group showing borderline fatigue compared to 73% severe fatigue in the control group. The reduction was statistically significant (p=0.000).
population_specificity: Patients undergoing hemodialysis in southern India.
effective_dosage: Lower back and lower leg massage at the beginning and after every hour of hemodialysis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of massage, along with yoga, music, and exercise, in preventing and treating prenatal depression.
results_summary: The study found low to very low evidence that massage could reduce antenatal depression, though music was identified as potentially the most effective intervention among the methods studied.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with or at risk of prenatal depression.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of fundal massage in managing primary postpartum hemorrhage (PPH) as part of standard obstetric interventions.
results_summary: The study highlights that fundal massage, alongside uterotonics and other interventions, is a primary method for managing PPH, particularly in cases of uterine atony. It is part of a broader approach that includes minimally invasive and definitive surgical options when necessary.
population_specificity: Delivering mothers experiencing primary postpartum hemorrhage.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of SCM stretching and massage on pain, range of motion, endurance, disability, and kinesiophobia in individuals with chronic neck pain.
results_summary: The study found that SCM stretching and massage, combined with conventional physiotherapy, significantly improved pain, disability, range of motion (extension, left-lateral flexion, and rotations), and endurance compared to the control group. No significant differences were observed in flexion, right-lateral flexion ROM, or kinesiophobia between groups.
population_specificity: Individuals with chronic neck pain (n=60, split into intervention and control groups).
effective_dosage: Treatment sessions were administered three times per week (specific massage duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of Hugo's point massage and play on the severity of IV-line placement pain in hospitalized children aged 3-6 years.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant difference in IV-line placement pain between the play, Hugo's point massage, and control groups before interventions.
population_specificity: Hospitalized children aged 3-6 years in a pediatric ward.

study_goal: To synthesize the effect of aromatherapy (including massage methods) on fatigue in adults receiving hemodialysis treatment through a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Aromatherapy, applied via inhalation and massage, had a large and positive effect on reducing fatigue in adults undergoing hemodialysis, with high heterogeneity observed across studies. The findings suggest aromatherapy can be an effective intervention for fatigue management in this population.
population_specificity: Adults receiving hemodialysis treatment.
effective_dosage: Applied for 2 to 30 minutes per session, in 3 to 30 sessions.
study_duration: Varied by study, ranging from short-term (2 minutes) to longer-term (30 sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between hypothalamus-intestinal interaction in treating insomnia via abdominal massage and compare its effects to drug treatment and healthy controls.
results_summary: The study found that abdominal vibration and ring massage therapy improved insomnia symptoms, enhanced neuron activity, and strengthened functional connections between the hypothalamus and parahippocampal gyrus. It also suggested potential brain-gut interaction mechanisms, though detailed results were pending further analysis.
population_specificity: 60 chronic insomnia volunteers and 30 healthy volunteers.
effective_dosage: Abdominal rubbing and vibration massage once daily for 30 minutes, 5 days per course, totaling 4 courses.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of massage therapy in reducing anxiety, stress, and fear of childbirth in expectant fathers.
results_summary: The study found that massage therapy, among other non-pharmacological interventions, could reduce anxiety, stress, and fear of childbirth in expectant fathers, though no single intervention was identified as the best.
population_specificity: Expectant fathers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical impact of abdominal manipulation (massage) as a treatment for empacho and its association with delayed diagnosis and complications in pediatric patients with acute appendicitis.
results_summary: The study found that abdominal manipulation for empacho was associated with delayed diagnosis of acute appendicitis, leading to severe complications such as gastrointestinal perforation, appendicular mass, intra-abdominal abscess, and gangrenous appendicitis. Symptoms worsened after manipulation, including increased pain intensity and digestive disturbances.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients aged 6-16 years (median 14 years), half from rural areas, with complicated acute appendicitis and a history of abdominal manipulation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of pelvic floor muscle training (PFMT) combined with connective tissue massage (CTM) versus PFMT alone on overactive bladder (OAB) symptoms, pelvic floor muscle strength, and quality of life in women.
results_summary: Both PFMT+CTM and PFMT alone improved pelvic floor muscle strength and reduced OAB symptoms, but PFMT+CTM showed superior outcomes in reducing OAB symptoms, urgency, and improving quality of life compared to PFMT alone. The benefits were observed both early (week 3) and late (week 6) in the treatment period.
population_specificity: Women with overactive bladder (OAB) symptoms.
effective_dosage: CTM was applied 3 days a week; PFMT was applied daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining muscle energy techniques (METs) with Swedish massage improves sleep quality in patients with chronic cervical spine pain.
results_summary: Both groups (massage alone and massage with METs) showed significant improvement in sleep disturbances. The MET group improved in all PSQI components, while the control group improved in only 4 components.
population_specificity: Forty patients with chronic cervical spine pain.
effective_dosage: 10 sessions of Swedish massage (study group also received MET sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of light massage and music therapy in reducing cancer-related pain and fatigue in adult patients with acute leukemia undergoing chemotherapy.
results_summary: Light massage significantly reduced pain and fatigue intensity over time compared to standard care, with greater pain reduction than music therapy. The effects of massage persisted longer than music therapy after the intervention ended.
population_specificity: Adult patients with acute leukemia receiving chemotherapy in Ahvaz, Iran.
study_duration: 4 weeks of intervention, with a 2-week follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare and rank the efficacy and safety of non-pharmacological interventions, including massage therapy, for managing labor pain.
results_summary: The study found that massage therapy (SMD = -1.26, 95% CrI -2.26 to -0.30) had significant positive effects on alleviating labor pain, though it was less effective than aromatherapy and acupressure. No significant differences were noted between non-pharmacological interventions and usual care regarding pharmacological method use or neonatal outcomes.
population_specificity: Low-risk pregnant women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether foot massage could reduce chemotherapy-induced fatigue in gastrointestinal cancer patients.
results_summary: The study found that foot massage significantly reduced fatigue scores immediately after and 24 hours after chemotherapy in the intervention group, while fatigue increased in the control group. The effect was statistically significant and clinically meaningful.
population_specificity: Gastrointestinal cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy (mean age 59.18 ± 9.35, most common cancer type was gastric cancer at 40%).
effective_dosage: Four sessions of foot massage (7 minutes per foot) with 40-minute intervals during chemotherapy.
study_duration: Administered during a single chemotherapy session (3 hours).

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine whether emollient massage (with sunflower seed oil or Aquaphor®) improved neurodevelopmental outcomes in preterm infants during early childhood.
results_summary: Massage with sunflower seed oil or Aquaphor® reduced neurodevelopmental delays compared to controls, with significant improvements in fine motor skills (SSO) and lower disability rates in psychomotor development (Aquaphor®).
population_specificity: Hospitalized preterm infants <33 weeks' gestational age in Bangladesh.
effective_dosage: Not specified (applied through the neonatal period or until hospital discharge).
study_duration: Neonatal period or until hospital discharge, with follow-up assessments up to 2 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify and map nonpharmacological interventions, including massage therapy, used to prevent perioperative anxiety in adolescents.
results_summary: Massage therapy was identified as one of several nonpharmacological interventions used to reduce perioperative anxiety in adolescents, though it was less commonly studied compared to music therapy and hypnosis. The abstract does not provide specific efficacy data for massage therapy alone.
population_specificity: Adolescents aged 10-19 undergoing surgical procedures.

study_goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of therapeutic massage in managing symptom clusters, particularly pain-anxiety-worry-dyspnea, in children and adolescents with cancer undergoing palliative care.
results_summary: Therapeutic massage showed statistically significant results for managing the pain-anxiety-worry-dyspnea symptom cluster in two studies, suggesting potential effectiveness in palliative care settings.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents with cancer undergoing palliative care.
